CreateIndex.document: This API is used to create indices.
CreateIndex.name: Creates indices

CreateInstance.document: This API is used to create an ES cluster instance with the specified specification.
CreateInstance.name: Creates an ES cluster instance

DeleteIndex.document: This API is used to delete indices.
DeleteIndex.name: Deletes indices

DeleteInstance.document: This API is used to terminate a cluster instance.
DeleteInstance.name: Terminates an ES cluster instance

DescribeIndexList.document: This API is used to obtain the index list.
DescribeIndexList.name: Obtains the index list

DescribeIndexMeta.document: This API is used to obtain index metadata.
DescribeIndexMeta.name: Obtains index metadata

DescribeInstanceLogs.document: This API is used to query the eligible ES cluster logs in the current region.
DescribeInstanceLogs.name: Queries ES cluster logs

DescribeInstanceOperations.document: This API is used to query the operation history of an instance by specified criteria.
DescribeInstanceOperations.name: Queries instance operation history

DescribeInstances.document: This API is used to query all eligible instances in the current region under the current account.
DescribeInstances.name: Queries ES cluster instances

DescribeViews.document: This API is used to query view data from three dimensions: cluster, node, and Kibana.
DescribeViews.name: Queries cluster views

GetRequestTargetNodeTypes.document: This API is used to get the node types used to receive client requests.
GetRequestTargetNodeTypes.name: Gets the node types used to receive client requests

RestartInstance.document: This API is used to restart an ES cluster instance (for operations such as system update).
RestartInstance.name: Restarts an ES cluster instance

RestartKibana.document: This API is used to restart Kibana.
RestartKibana.name: Restarts Kibana

RestartNodes.document: This API is used to restart cluster nodes.
RestartNodes.name: Restarts cluster nodes

UpdateDictionaries.document: This API is used to update ES cluster dictionaries.
UpdateDictionaries.name: Updates ES cluster dictionaries

UpdateIndex.document: This API is used to update indices.
UpdateIndex.name: Updates indices

UpdateInstance.document:
This API is used for operations such as modifying node specification, renaming an instance, modifying configuration, resetting password, and setting Kibana blocklist/allowlist. `InstanceId` is required, while `ForceRestart` is optional. Other parameters or parameter combinations and their meanings are as follows:
- InstanceName: renames an instance (only for instance identification)
- NodeInfoList: modifies node configuration (horizontally scaling nodes, vertically scaling nodes, adding primary nodes, adding cold nodes, etc.)
- EsConfig: modifies cluster configuration
- Password: changes the password of the default user "elastic"
- EsAcl: modifies the ACL
- CosBackUp: sets auto-backup to COS for a cluster
Only one of the parameters or parameter combinations above can be passed in at a time, while passing fewer or more ones will cause the request to fail.
UpdateInstance.name: Updates an ES cluster instance

UpdatePlugins.document: This API is used to change the list of plugins.
UpdatePlugins.name: Changes plugin list

UpdateRequestTargetNodeTypes.document: This API is used to update the node types used to receive client requests.
UpdateRequestTargetNodeTypes.name: Updates the node types used to receive client requests

UpgradeInstance.document: This API is used to upgrade ES cluster version
UpgradeInstance.name: Upgrades ES cluster version

UpgradeLicense.document: This API is used to upgrade ES X-Pack.
UpgradeLicense.name: Upgrades ES X-Pack

NodeInfo.document: Specification information of a node type in the cluster (such as hot data node, warm data node, or dedicated primary node), including node type, number of nodes, node specification, disk type, and disk size. If `Type` is not specified, it will be a hot data node by default; if the node is a primary node, then the `DiskType` and `DiskSize` parameters will be ignored (as a primary node has no data disks)

members.document:
Node information list. You can pass in only the nodes to be updated and their corresponding specification information. Supported operations include:
  • modifying the number of nodes in the same type
  • modifying the specification and disk size of nodes in the same type
  • adding a node type (you must also specify the node type, quantity, specification, disk, etc.)
    • The above operations can only be performed one at a time, and the disk type cannot be modified
